required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Pregnancy Related Immunological, Clinical and Epidemiological Factors and Perinatal Outcomes
clinical_study.official_title: COVID-19 in Pregnancy: Utilizing Immunology Through Epidemiology to Improve Perinatal/Neonatal Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective cohort study of pregnant patients at an urban academic center diagnosed with perinatal COVID-19 infection, followed up to 6 weeks postpartum.

detailed_description.textblock: This proposal aims to provide a multi-faceted approach to addressing perinatal COVID-19 infection by (1) improving our understanding of SARS-CoV-2 antibody specificity and durability over the course of pregnancy/postpartum in mother/baby dyad (2) understanding the downstream implications of maternal systemic inflammatory response with COVID-19 infection through study of fetal inflammatory response, placental pathology, and perinatal outcomes, and (3) to evaluate the interplay between socioeconomic characteristics, COVID-19, and early neonatal outcomes. (4) Evaluate antibody generation and durability in pregnant/breastfeeding women who receive any form of the COVID-19 vaccine

primary_outcome.description: IgG/IgM time profile through pregnancy up to 6 weeks post partum for those exposed to COVID-19
IgG/IgM at delivery in mother/neonate through maternal and cord blood sampling

primary_outcome.measure: Maternal COVID serology time/profile following vaccination

primary_outcome.description: Breastmilk IgG and IgA time profile following COVID vaccine in breastfeeding women

secondary_outcome.description: COVID-19 IgG and IgA in breast milk
COVID-19 IgG and IgA in breastmilk
Compare maternal COVID (+) and COVID (-) cytokine panel
Compare cordblood cytokine panel between COVID(+) and COVID (-) at delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: COVID disease vs vaccination immune response
secondary_outcome.description: Compare maternal IgG concentration time/profile in those with COVID disease vs COVID vaccine

secondary_outcome.measure: COVID vaccine in pregnant vs nonpregnant
secondary_outcome.description: Compare maternal IgG concentration/time profile in pregnant vs non-pregnant women with vaccine

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with COVID-19 during pregnancy or while breastfeeding
Patients who receive COVID-19 vaccine during pregnancy or while breastfeeding
Reproductive age women exposed to COVID-19 vaccine
Pregnant women who delivered at TJUH, COVID negative

biospec_descr.textblock:
- Maternal serum/plasma
- SARS-CoV-2 serology
- Cytokine/chemokine panel
- Cord blood serum/plasm
- SARS-CoV-2 serology
- Cytokine/chemokine panel
- DNA methylation, miRNA/mRNA exression
- Breastmilk o SARS-CoV-2 serology

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant patients diagnosed with COVID-19 at any point during pregnancy or within 6 weeks post partum

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of COVID-19 in pregnancy or within 6 months post partum
- Planned delivery at Thomas Jefferson University Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Declines routine COVID testing on admission
- In active labor/pain/otherwise unable to provide consent
